column2: Chinese rivals snap at Alibaba's heels in cross-border e-commerce race SHANGHAI
column3: Feb 26 A Chinese government push to promote e-commerce has created a host of online retail rivals for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd and Amazon.com Inc  catering to shoppers' fears about the quality and safety of local everyday goods.

column2: American Express to raise credit card rates - BloombergUPDATE 1-American Express to raise rates on some U.S. credit cards Feb 25 American Express Co is raising interest rates for a large number of its credit cards following a review that began a year ago
column3: a company spokeswoman said.  UPDATE 1-American Express to raise rates on some U.S. credit cards Feb 25 American Express Co is raising interest rates for a large number of its credit cards following a review that began a year ago
column4: a company spokeswoman said. Feb 25 American Express Co is raising interest rates for over 1 million cardholders for the first time in more than five years
column5: Bloomberg reported.UPDATE 1-American Express to raise rates on some U.S. credit cards Feb 25 American Express Co is raising interest rates for a large number of its credit cards following a review that began a year ago

column2: UPDATE 2-Anthem says hack may affect more than 8.8 million other BCBS members NEW YORK
column3: Feb 24 Health insurer Anthem Inc
column4: which earlier this month reported that it was hit by a massive cyberbreach
column5: said on Tuesday that 8.8 million to 18.8 million people who were members of other Blue Cross Blue Shield plans could be victims in the attack.

column2: MOVES-BlackRock hires Thomas Muller to manage European real estate portfolio Feb 25 BlackRock Inc
column3: the world's largest money manager
column4: appointed Thomas Muller as managing director and portfolio manager of its European real estate business.

column2: Democrats lodge U.S. Export-Import Bank survival planUPDATE 1-Senators work on bipartisan U.S. Export-Import Bank survival plan WASHINGTON
column3: Feb 25 U.S. senators said on Wednesday they are working on a bipartisan plan to keep the U.S. Export-Import Bank open but the treatment of coal-fired power projects is holding up a final deal.  UPDATE 1-Senators work on bipartisan U.S. Export-Import Bank survival plan WASHINGTON
column4: Feb 25 U.S. senators said on Wednesday they are working on a bipartisan plan to keep the U.S. Export-Import Bank open but the treatment of coal-fired power projects is holding up a final deal. WASHINGTON
column5: Feb 25 Democratic lawmakers will unveil a plan on Wednesday to keep the U.S. Export-Import Bank open for another seven years and expand its lending as a clash over the bank's future intensifies.UPDATE 1-Senators work on bipartisan U.S. Export-Import Bank survival plan WASHINGTON
column6: Feb 25 U.S. senators said on Wednesday they are working on a bipartisan plan to keep the U.S. Export-Import Bank open but the treatment of coal-fired power projects is holding up a final deal.

column2: Chesapeake Energy has quarterly profit
column3: slashing spendingBRIEF-Chesapeake expects service cost savings of 10 pct in 2015UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations.  UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations. * CFO says expects service cost savings of about 10 percent in 2015UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations. Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending in response to low crude oil prices and reported a fourth-quarter profit compared with a year-earlier loss as results were boosted by hedging gains.BRIEF-Chesapeake expects service cost savings of 10 pct in 2015UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations.  UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations. * CFO says expects service cost savings of about 10 percent in 2015UPDATE 2-Chesapeake profit falls short; company to slash spending Feb 25 Chesapeake Energy Corp on Wednesday said it would slash its 2015 spending and rig count in response to low crude oil prices that also pushed its fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations.
